intro: Coluria omeiensis var. nanzhengensis, commonly known as the Nanzheng coluria, is a rare flowering plant native to southwestern China. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive floral structure. The plant produces small, white to pale purple flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the spring season. Its leaves are lance-shaped with a slightly hairy surface, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
